title: Sectional Mock 8 - English
instruction: In the questions given below, a sentence has been broken down into four fragments labeled (A), (B), (C) and (D) and arranged, not necessarily in the correct order. You have to find the correct order of arrangement from the options given below. In case, the sentence is correct in its original form, please select (E) as your answer.

quiz.text: What is the opposite meaning of the phrase ‘ramp up’?
options: accrue
accumulate
proliferate
dwindle
burgeon

quiz.text: Which of the following steps may be taken to boost the Electric vehicles segment in India?
options: Limiting registration of conventional vehicles through public lotteries and preferential registration for electric vehicles.
Bulk procurement of electric vehicles and building standardized and swappable batteries to bring down the cost as well as having favorable tariff structures for charging vehicles.
Incentivizing use of EVs by lowering taxes, interest rates on loans, electricity tariffs for fleet operators and duties on manufacturing such cars
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: The author mentions “marking a pivotal moment for the industry” as used in Paragraph 5 with reference to lithium battery usage. Which of the following, if true, would aid in “marking a pivotal moment for the industry”? I. Lithium-ion battery packs for electric cars have fallen in price by about 80% since 2010, according to consulting firm McKinsey. II. While electric motors are much more efficient than internal combustion engines, batteries can store only a small fraction of the energy in fossil fuels. Some of today’s EVs can run out of juice in as little as 100 miles. III. Battery makers increasingly require diverse skills, including cell-level chemistry, the complex electronics used in battery pack systems and power and thermal management software among others but most critical are cell design and manufacturing expertise. There is however, a dearth of talent for this currently in the industry IV. A replacement battery pack for GM’s Chevrolet Bolt is priced at more than $15,700 (£12,150) – representing over 40% of the cost of the entire vehicle.
options: Only (IV) is correct
Only (I) is correct
(I), (III) and (IV) are correct
Both (I) and (IV) are correct
All are correct

quiz.text: What is/are the author’s viewpoint(s) in accordance with Paragraph 5? I. The author views the growth of lithium-ion battery with a sceptical eye. II. The author opines such a huge growth in batteries would create a glut in the market and lead to oversupply. III. Lithium batteries are the future for electric vehicles and although currently their usage is not at par with that of consumer products, it is predicted to increase in the future.
options: Only (I) is correct
Only (III) is correct
Both (II) and (III) are correct
Both (I) and (III) are correct
All are correct

quiz.text: What could be the possible reason for being “well wide of the mark” in predicting car sales as used in Paragraph 3? I.  The market is rapidly growing but has a plethora of different all-electric models to choose from and gives the consumer plenty of options. II. The high cost of batteries means it still costs more to build an electric car than one with a traditional combustion engine. Few consumers are willing to pay a premium, even when subsidies and other state incentives are taken into account III. Gigantic size of the automotive market- with around 2 billion cars on the roads around the world and an annual production capacity of roughly 100 million cars- it would take 20 years to update the global fleet. It means that once all new cars sold are equipped with a new technology, like electric propulsion, it can take up to 20 years to refresh the fleet.
options: Only (II) is correct
Only (I) is correct
Both (I) and (II) are correct
Both (I) and (III) are correct
All are correct

quiz.text: What is the opposite of the phrase “Until recently, it was a transition that many found unthinkable” as mentioned in the Paragraph 2?
options: Electric cars cause pollution indirectly. While themselves being clean, there are toxic elements within batteries and which could spew toxic fumes. Further, the car’s engines are powered by electricity, and all of which isn’t generated from renewable energy sources. This means electric power production per se entails pollution.

Most affordable electric cars only have about 80 to 100 miles of range, and take hours to fully refuel. As a result, nearly all electric car drivers experience range anxiety and need a back-up range-extending engine or else better route planning

Currently, the supply of electric cars outweighs demand. They are also costly as far as the sticker price is concerned and mainstream consumers put more emphasis on the upfront cost of a electric car rather than the lifetime cost

The vehicle manufacturing industry has been witnessing a slow but steady growth in the popularity of electric or hybrid vehicles over the years backed by adequate investment in R&D and incentives like tax breaks and subsidies from the government
None of the above

quiz.text: Water and food scarcities during drought periods not only accentuate household suffering, but can distort intra-household conflicts. I. Drought periods lead to distortion of intra-house conflicts due to household suffering leading to water and food scarcities. II. Accentuation of household suffering is caused by water and food scarcities and focuses on distorting intra-household conflicts. III. Drought periods lead to water and food scarcities which accentuate household suffering as well as distort intra-household conflicts.
options: Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III
None of the above

quiz.text: Over the last 50 years, groundwater has emerged as the backbone of irrigated agriculture in India. I. After 50 years, groundwater has emerged as the backbone of irrigated agriculture in India. II. Groundwater has become the sole source of irrigated agriculture in India over a span of 50 years. III. In the last 50 years, groundwater has survived as the backbone of irrigated agriculture in India.
options: Only I
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III
All are incorrect

quiz.text: Water scarcity is expected to grow in the future, exacerbated by climatic changes in precipitation patterns and increase in temperatures. I. Compounded by climatic changes in terms of rainfall patterns and increase in temperatures, water scarcity is expected to grow in the future. II. Climate changes like precipitation patterns and temperature increase are expected to grown in the future and would result in more water scarcity. III. It would be an exaggeration to state that water scarcity, due to climatic changes in precipitation patterns and increase in temperatures, is expected to grow in the future
options: Only I
Only III
Only I and II
Only I and II
Only II and III

quiz.text: Which among the following would grammatically and contextually fit in the blank (A) in the paragraph?
options: Fragment
Dire
Terminal
Yielding
Detrimental

quiz.text: Which among the following connector(s) would join the sentences C and D keeping them grammatically and contextually correct and the meaning intact? I. So that II. Because III. Nonetheless
options: Only III
Both I and II
Both I and III
Both II and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: The sentence given in (E) has four words given in bold. Amongst the given bold words which of the following must replace each other to make the sentence contextually correct and meaningful.
options: 1-3 and 2-4
1-2 and 3-4
Only 1-4
Only 2-4
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following convey(s) the meaning as the Statement F and is / are grammatically and contextually correct? I. There is a window spanning around 10 minutes each day from now onwards for a week that takes into account all the deciding factors. II. The window of 10 minutes every day is available for the week to come is available taking into account all the important factors. III. Throughout the next week, a window of 10 minutes will be available every day that has all the factors in factored in.
options: Both I and II
Both II and III
Both I and III
None of I, II and III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: Which of the following word given in the options should come at the place marked as (B) in the above paragraph to make it grammatically correct and meaningful. Also, the word should fill in the two sentences given below to make them contextually correct and meaningful.   I. They are ____________ to make sure that they come out as the winning side at the end of the match. II. The ____________ approach of the players was the main deciding factor between the two sides.
options: Determined
Earnest
Terminal
Clear
None of the above

quiz.text: G
options: acclaim
reprimand
rendezvous
kennels
dejected

quiz.text: Which word shall replace (H)?
options: suitable
elementary
indigenous
insanity
None of these

quiz.text: Which among the following would come after the Statement F after the rearrangement?
options: F is the last statement
C
B
D
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following would be the SIXTH (LAST) sentence after the rearrangement?
options: B
E
C
D
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following would precede the Statement C after the rearrangement?
options: F
B
D
E
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following would be the Fourth sentence of the paragraph after the rearrangement?
options: D
C
B
E
F

quiz.text: Which among the following would be the SECOND statement of the paragraph after the rearrangement?
options: E
F
D
C
B

quiz.text: Victoria Reiter came to know her days were numbered because of 1. the immune system booster. 2. chronic myeloid leukemia. 3. failure of interferon.
options: All the three
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
None of these.

quiz.text: Choose the word or group of words which is most OPPOSITE in meaning as the word printed in BOLD as use in the passage. Rapacious
options: Greedy
Exorbitant
Abominable
Noble
Inhuman

quiz.text: Choose the word or group of words which is most SIMILAR in meaning as the word printed in BOLD as use in the passage. Figured
options: Drew diagram
Quoted price
Paid cash
Maintained health
Gained understanding.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is definitely TRUE about Gleevec?
options: Medical scientists are vehemently asserting that Gleevec cures cancer.
The patient requires to take Gleevec for the entire residual part of his life.
Certain other drug supplement is necessary to be combined with Gleevec.
Probability of reoccurrence of cancer is high if Gleevec is not supplemented with other drugs.
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following characteristics are applicable to Gleevec? 1. The drug doesn’t help anyone suffering from nausea and muscle cramps. 2. It is not free from side-effects. 3. It is effective in curing a rare form of stomach cancer.
options: All the three above
1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
None of these.

quiz.text: What was the impact of Gleevec on the health of Victoria Reiter?
options: Her bone marrow was full of clear cells of leukemia.
She started suffering from Argentine tango.
She regained her lost speech and could read aloud.
Her health showed clear symptoms of recovery.
None of these

quiz.text: Victoria Reiter had decided to 1. Divide her property between her two daughters owing to her chronic illness. 2. Postpone her plan of dividing her possessions between her two daughters as she had started recovering. 3. Undergo a treatment with an experimental drug called Gleevec when the interferon treatment was found to be futile.
options: All the three above
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
None of these.

quiz.text: That from January 2018, user charges in public hospitals for various services will (A) / services tax (GST) and to finance better quality services and improved maintenance (B) / At the end of 2017, the Maharashtra government issued a government resolution (C) / increase substantially, in order to cover the increased costs to hospitals due to goods and (D)
options: DABC
CBAD
BACD
CADB
No rearrangement required

quiz.text: Constructed role for women places them in the (A) / domestic sphere and prevents them from undertaking (B) / social, economic, and political activities designated for men (C) / In traditional, patriarchal societies, the culturally (D)
options: ADCB
BCDA
DABC
DACB
No rearrangement required
